title: Benjamin Netanyahu given first chance to form Israeli government after stalemate election
text:
Benjamin Netanyahu has been given the first chance to form Israel’s government after last week’s stalemated election, offering the prime minister a difficult but not impossible path to continue holding on to power.

Mr Netanyahu’s Likud party emerged from last week’s election slightly Blue & White, the centrist party led by former general Benny Gantz, but neither side has a clear path to forming a majority government.

Israel’s president, Reuven Rivlin, attempted to broker a power-sharing agreement between the two sides but said on Wednesday night that those efforts had broken down and therefore he was offering Mr Netanyahu the first chance to form a government.

More to follow...
description: Benjamin Netanyahu has been given the first chance to form Israel’s government after last week’s stalemated election, offering the prime minister a difficult but not impossible path to continue holding on to power.
